metadata.synopsis: When private investigator and man of action John Shaft (Richard Roundtree) is hired to disrupt a slavery ring, he must travel to Africa and infiltrate the criminal operation. While undercover, Shaft discovers that Africans are being abducted and sold as slaves in Europe, with a sinister figure named Amafi (Frank Finlay) pulling the strings. As Shaft gets closer to taking down Amafi, his situation becomes increasingly dangerous, with assassins and thugs seemingly lurking around every corner.

reviews: Shaft in Africa takes detective John Shaft to Ethiopia for some fast-paced exploits as he tracks down the leader of a slave trade gang in much the best of the Shaft pictures.
Includes some of the series' best moments.
Follows along the lines of a James Bond thriller.
Slow action film with Roundtree misplaced, overdone, overshown.
